abstract: British Judge David Burns clears former News of the World editor Andy Coulson of perjury charges in connection with his statements about tabloid's practice of eavesdropping on voice mail messages of public figures.
lead_paragraph: A former tabloid editor, Andy Coulson, was cleared of perjury as a judge said Wednesday that any lies he might have told under oath were not relevant to the trial in question.

headline.print_headline: Europe; Britain: Ex-Editor Cleared of Perjury

snippet: A former tabloid editor, Andy Coulson, was cleared of perjury as a judge said Wednesday that any lies he might have told under oath were not relevant to the trial in question.
